active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the value of strategic intelligence reports versus tactical IoC sharing for C-suite executives facing geopolitical cyber threats. Support arguments with examples from the Threat Intelligence Lifecycle (003_Threat Intelligence Lifecycle) and MITRE ATT&CK TTPs, encouraging critical thinking on long-term vs. short-term decision-making.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for university-level cybersecurity education on 'Strategic Intelligence Report Writing' (full hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Threat Intelligence And Hunting > 003_Threat Intelligence Lifecycle > 005_Analysis and Production > Intelligence Product Development > Strategic Intelligence Report Writing). Use the provided learning objectives, active learning activities, 4-layer scaffolding, and exact flashcard schema to create optimized Anki-style flashcards. Core Content: Strategic intelligence reports provide high-level, actionable insights for executives on threats, motivations, trends (vs. tactical IoCs, operational TTPs). Key sections: Executive Summary, Threat Landscape, Implications, Recommendations. Frameworks: MITRE ATT&CK TTPs/IoCs, CTI Blueprints (https://cti-blueprints.readthedocs.io/en/latest/, SANS: https://www.sans.org/reading-room/whitepapers/threat-intelligence/). Prior knowledge: Threat Intelligence Lifecycle stages. Learning Objectives: [INSERT FULL LIST FROM ABOVE]. Scaffolding: [INSERT FULL SCAFFOLDING FROM ABOVE]. Generate 25 flashcards: 30% REMEMBER/UNDERSTAND (Layer 1), 30% APPLY/ANALYZE (Layer 2-3), 40% EVALUATE/CREATE (Layer 4). Each flashcard MUST follow the exact schema: Front (question with hierarchy reference), Back (answer + exactly 3 distractors with 'why_wrong' explanations + full explanation + bloom_level + scaffolding_layer). Incorporate active learning hooks: e.g., questions prompting discussion-like analysis. Ensure distractors are plausible (e.g., tactical vs strategic confusion). Output as JSON array of objects, no extra text.
